Springfield.Land of Providence: Land of Providence is a 25-acre (100,000 m2) open space reservation located in Holyoke, Massachusetts on the banks of the Connecticut River. The property was previously owned by the Sisters of Providence. In 2009 it was donated to The Trustees of Reservations and is now used for farming by the local organization Nuestras Raices, which allows local residents farm the land and raise livestock.
